intro: Dyschoriste oligosperma, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dyschoris, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color, arranged in whorled clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
